newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: PRESS DIGEST - Ivory Coast - Jan 10.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Ivory Coast - Jan 10.

text.p: These are significant items in the Ivorian press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these items and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- France Telecom in pole position for takeover of Ivorian phone company CI-TELCOM after second round of bidding. France Telecom and Telekom Malaysia remain the only contenders for a 51 percent strategic stake in CI-TELCOM after Ivorian consortium Africa Bell, which chose AT&T as a partner, was disqualified.

- Privatised rail operator SITARAIL calls international tenders for supply of trucks for use in construction work on Abidjan-Ouagadougou-Kaya rail line; deal will be financed by foreign credits secured by Burkina Faso, a co-sponsor of rail project. Tender details from SITARAIL: Ivory Coast - tel +225 21 06 36 fax 22 48 47; Burkina Faso tel +226 31 07 39 fax 31 07 33 for March 4, 1997, closing date.
- Privatisation of CI-TELCOM: Americans rejected to the benefit of the French
- Six Guineans and a Frenchman arrested for illegal timber exploitation in western Ivory Coast
- Africa Bell protests against disqualification from bidding for CI-TELCOM.
